components.label: programYear
components.calculateValue:
const [programYear] = data.programYearStartDate ? data.programYearStartDate.split("-"):[];
value = programYear ? programYear:"";

components.label: Study end date before six weeks from today
components.calculateValue:
/**
 * Validates if the date provided is before six weeks from today.
 *
 * The same validation exists on calculating selectedStudyEndDateBeforeSixWeeksFromToday,
 * other student application forms, program information request form
 * and also on the server side.
 *
 * When there is an update to this logic make sure to update in all the above.
 *
 */

// If program/study period not listed is selected, validate the study end date to be after given days before six weeks from today.
value = !!data.studyendDate && moment(data.studyendDate).isBefore(moment().add(6, 'week'));

components.label: Selected study end date before six weeks from today
components.calculateValue:
/**
 * Validates if the date provided is before six weeks from today.
 *
 * The same validation exists on calculating studyEndDateBeforeSixWeeksFromToday,
 * other student application forms, program information request form
 * and also on the server side.
 *
 * When there is an update to this logic make sure to update in all the above.
 *
 */

// If a study period is selected, validate its study end date to be before six weeks from today.
value =
  !!data.selectedOfferingEndDate && moment(data.selectedOfferingEndDate).isBefore(moment().add(6, 'week'));

components.content: Family information

components.label: Do you have any eligible dependants?
components.tooltip:
For StudentAid BC purposes, eligible dependents/dependants are any dependents for whom the Canada Child Tax Benefit is claimed, or for whom a benefit is claimed on the applicant’s income tax return. Eligible dependents/dependants must meet one of the following criteria:

- For the student’s or spouse/common-law partner’s children who are 18 years of age and under, the student and/or spouse/common-law partner must be guardians of the children who must live with the student or spouse/common-law partner at least two full days per week; or

- The student’s or spouse/common-law partner’s children aged 19 to 22 are full-time dependent students in study; or

- The student’s or spouse/common-law partner’s children are permanently disabled, are 19 years of age or over, are fully supported by the student or spouse/common-law partner and are claimed on the student’s or spouse/common-law partner’s income tax return; or

- The children are the student’s foster children and foster-parent income is claimed on the application; or

- The dependents are the student’s or spouse/common-law partner’s elderly relatives who are fully supported by the student and claimed on the student’s or spouse’s income tax.

components.label: Are you a student with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability, and applying for disability grants?
components.tooltip:
If you are a student with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability, as defined below, you may be eligible for additional student financial assistance.

Permanent Disability:
Any impairment, including a physical, mental, intellectual, cognitive, learning, communication or sensory impairment - or a functional limitation - that restricts the ability of a person to perform the daily activities necessary to pursue studies at a post secondary school level or to participate in the labour force and that is expected to remain with the person for the person’s expected life.

Persistent or Prolonged Disability:
Any impairment, including a physical, mental, intellectual, cognitive, learning, communication or sensory impairment - or a functional limitation - that restricts the ability of a person to perform the daily activities necessary to pursue studies at a post secondary school level or to participate in the labour force and has lasted, or is expected to last, for a period of at least 12 months but is not expected to remain with the person for the person’s expected life.

If you answer 'no' to this question, you will not be assessed for, or receive, disability funding.

components.label: Content
components.content:
Info!
Please note you must have your disability status verified by StudentAid BC to receive disability funding. If your disability status has already been verified, no further action is required.

If your disability status has not yet been verified by StudentAid BC, you must complete an Appendix 8 for Part-Time Students - Disability Programs Application to verify your permanent, or persistent or prolonged disability, and have your disability approved.

Students with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability may qualify for other programs. Contact the Accessibility Services Coordinator or financial aid office at your school, or visit www.StudentAidBC.ca

components.label: Are you a resident of B.C.?
components.tooltip:
As a student you are a considered to be a resident of B.C. if one of the following criteria are met:

B.C. is the province where you last lived for 12 continuous months, as of your study start date, not including months of full-time post-secondary study; or

You are an independent permanent resident, or designated as a protected person, living in B.C. at the time of application and will spend the study period in B.C. but have not lived in any one province for at least 12 continuous months. For example, if an independent student arrived in Canada as a permanent resident less than 12 months before the start date of classes, and intends to study in B.C., the student would be considered a resident of B.C. for student financial assistance purposes.

components.label: Content
components.content:
For the purpose of verifying the data provided in this application for student assistance, I hereby consent to the release, by the Canada Revenue Agency, to the Ministry of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills (or a person delegated by the ministry), of taxpayer information from any portion of my income tax records that pertains to information given by me on any StudentAid BC application.
The information will be relevant to, and used solely for the purpose of determining and verifying my eligibility for and entitlement to the following programs: Canada Student Grant for students with Permanent Disabilities, the BC Supplemental Bursary for Students with a Permanent Disability, Canada Student Grant for Part-time Students, Canada Student Loan for Part-time Studies, and if eligible, Canada Student Grant for Part-time Students with Dependants under the Canada Student Financial Assistance Act.

This information will not be disclosed to any other person or organization without my prior approval. This authorization is valid for the two taxation years prior to the year of signature of this consent, the year of signature of this consent and for any other subsequent consecutive taxation year for which assistance is requested.

components.content: StudentAid BC consent

components.html:
I am applying for financial assistance in accordance with the terms and conditions set out in the current program year’s StudentAid BC Policy Manual and in accordance with the Canada Student Financial Assistance Act (the “Application”).  

I. I understand that:  

1. StudentAid BC of the Ministry of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills will determine the amount of money I am eligible to receive.

2. Providing false or misleading information on this Application could result in denial of student financial assistance and/or student loan debt repayment plan assistance now and in the future. This applies to the information I have submitted for this Application and any subsequent changes I make to this Application.

3. If I, or any third-party (as applicable) submitting supporting documentation for this Application, provide incomplete and/or inaccurate information, I may be denied student financial assistance and/or student loan debt repayment plan assistance now and in the future.

4. All information provided for this Application and in response to any further requests by StudentAid BC is subject to review by StudentAid BC.

5. If I receive money (loan or grant) from StudentAid BC and it is subsequently determined that this Application, or documents forming a part of it, is not accurate, I may be required to repay all or part of the money to StudentAid BC, with any accrued interest, if applicable. I will be required to do this if the error was made by me, my spouse/common law partner, parent(s), stepparent(s), sponsor, legal guardian, school or StudentAid BC. I will also be required to repay an “Overaward”, as defined in the current program year’s StudentAid BC Policy Manual, plus any accrued interest, if applicable, due to a change in my eligibility status.

6. This Application will not be complete until all required supporting documents are submitted by third parties (as applicable). If any information contained in these supporting documents changes the information in the Application, the Application may be subject to a reassessment.

7.  All information provided in this Application, and for the lifetime of my loans, may be reviewed and electronically matched with income tax information held by the Canada Revenue Agency, social insurance information held by Service Canada in the Employment and Social Development Program and disability benefits and/or income assistance information held by the BC Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction, or successor programs, ministries, and agencies that hold the information identified above, to verify reporting accuracy.

8. If I receive Canada - BC Integrated Student Financial Assistance, a portion or all of the funding (loan or grant) may, at the school’s request, be sent directly to the school to pay educational fees.

9. If I cease to be eligible for funding, any tuition refunds I am eligible to receive will be sent by my school directly to the Federal and/or Provincial governments or its agents to be applied to any outstanding loan principal or Overawards.

II. I understand that by signing below it means:  

1. I have read the information available on the StudentAid BC website about B.C. student financial assistance and the Application process.

2.  I have accurately answered all questions pertaining to myself on this Application and the information contained in all supporting documents that I have provided as part of the Application is accurate. I have not altered or added to the application form provided by StudentAid BC except for providing the required information.

3. I will be a “Full-Time Student”, as defined in the current program year’s StudentAid BC Policy Manual, for the entire study period stated in this Application and will maintain a “Satisfactory Scholastic Standing”, as defined in the current program year’s StudentAid BC Policy Manual.

4. None of the courses used to meet the minimum 60 percent (40 percent for students with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability) of a full course load requirement for Full-Time Student status repeat or duplicate courses for which I have previously received credits.

5.  I must successfully complete at least 60 percent (40 percent for students with a permanent disability, or a persistent or prolonged disability) of a full course load for each application study period, or my eligibility for student financial assistance in future years of full-time post-secondary study will be affected.

6. I will use the funding I receive to pay my tuition and other academic fees first; then, I will pay other educational costs and living costs directly related to my studies covered by this Application.

7. I have not applied, nor will I apply or receive student loans, grants or bursaries from another province or territory during the study period stated in this Application.

8. I will immediately notify StudentAid BC of any change in my income as reported on line 15000 of the previous year’s T1 General Income Tax and Benefit Return and/or other “Assessed Resources”, as defined in the current program year’s StudentAid BC Policy Manual.  

9. I will immediately notify StudentAid BC of any change in my spouse/common-law partner’s, parent(s)’, stepparent(s)’, sponsor’s or legal guardian’s income and/or assets, when I am made aware of the change.

10. I will immediately notify StudentAid BC of any changes in my address, academic status, marital status, or a reduction in the number of my dependents.

11. For the purpose of verifying, auditing and/or investigating information I have provided in the Application, and in supporting documents, conducting research, and facilitating the eventual repayment of my loan awards (whether defaulted or not) and any other money repayable, I consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of my personal information that I have provided in this Application and in supporting documents between the BC Ministry of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills, the BC Ministry of Finance, National Student Loans Service Centre, and any of their contractors, subcontractors or agents, each with each other, and with the following: financial institutions, educational institutions,  employers, credit bureaus, credit reporting agencies, indigenous organizations, federal and provincial Crown corporations, and federal, provincial, municipal ministries/departments/agencies, including but not limited to: BC Ministry of Social Development and Poverty Reduction, BC Ministry of Children and Family Development, BC Ministry of Health, BC Ministry of Attorney General, BC Ministry of Education and Child Care, BC Public Service Agency, RoadSafetyBC, Insurance Corporation of BC (and Service BC acting in the role of ICBC), BC Hydro, BC Assessment Authority, Land Title and Survey Authority of BC, BC Registry Services, WorkSafeBC, BC Vital Statistics Agency, the Office of the Superintendent of Bankruptcy Canada, Employment and Social Development Canada, Canada Revenue Agency, Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada. This consent takes effect on the date that I submit this Application to StudentAid BC, regardless of whether this Application is in electronic or paper format.

12. I consent to the disclosure of my name, date of birth, gender and contact information to the BC Ministry of Children and Family Development for the purpose of verifying my response if I have declared that I am a current or former BC youth in care. This consent takes effect when I submit this Application to StudentAid BC, regardless of whether this Application is in electronic or paper format. I understand that if I may be eligible for the Learning for Future Grant, and/or the Provincial Tuition Waiver Program for Former Youth in Care, I may be contacted by StudentAid BC regarding eligibility.

13. I consent to the use of my name, school program information and outstanding loan amounts by the BC Ministry of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills for the purpose of identifying student borrowers and processing claims in the event claims are filed in relation to an institution certified with the Private Training Institutions Branch. This consent takes effect when I submit the Application to StudentAid BC, regardless of whether this Application is in electronic or paper format.

14. If I have entered into any agreements or signed any promissory notes under StudentAid BC or its predecessor, the BC Student Assistance Program, while I was a minor, I hereby ratify and affirm those agreements and notes and acknowledge that I am bound by same.

15. The terms and conditions of this full-time Application Declaration apply to all associated supporting documents, including supporting documents which will be submitted by third parties (as applicable).  

Canada Revenue Agency Consent Form

I hereby consent to the disclosure of information from my income tax records, by the Canada Revenue Agency to an official of the Ministry of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills, that pertains to information provided on any Student Aid BC application. The information disclosed will be relevant to, and used solely for the purpose of, determining and verifying eligibility for student aid under the Canada Student Financial Assistance Act. The information disclosed by the Canada Revenue Agency to the Ministry of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills will be protected from unauthorized use or disclosure and will not be disclosed to any other person or organization without my approval. This authorization is valid for the two taxation years prior to the year of signature of this consent, and the year of signature.

Collection and use of information. The information included in this form and authorized above is collected under ss.26(c) and 26(e) of the Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 165, and under the authority of the Canada Student Financial Assistance Act, R.S.C. 1994, Chapter C-28. The information provided will be used to determine eligibility for a benefit through StudentAid BC and for research, statistical and evaluation purposes. If you have any questions about the collection and use of this information, contact the Executive Director, StudentAid BC, Ministry of Post-Secondary Education and Future Skills, PO Box 9173, Stn Prov Govt, Victoria BC, V8W 9H7, telephone 1-800-561-1818 (toll-free in Canada/U.S.) or 1-778-309-4621 from outside North America.
